page.title: 06The old port of Braunton.
page.content: In the{1900's}boats from{Barnstaple} and{Cardiff}unloaded loads of limestone at{Velator}to be taken away to the lime-kiln on the edge of the Great field.There the limestone was crushed and spread over the great field as a sort of fertillizer.The land at Velator is mostly farmed except for about 5 acres which is used for factories and houses.Most of the buildings at Velator are over 300 years old. {Marstage farm's}house in {1912}was burnt down so a new house was built with a tile roof.{Cattle}and {sheep}are the main livestock of Velator.The railway which used to run through part of Velator closed down in the 1970's.It went from{Ilfracombe through Velator (Braunton) and ended up at{Barnstaple.}This in turn connected to the western route to {London.
